channel.title: About on Philomath's Lair!
channel.description: Recent content in About on Philomath's Lair!

item.title: Work Work Work!
item.description: I am always up for working on new challenges. If you feel I can help you out with your problem, feel free to reach out to me with the details. I am skilled in Linux development and Python software development practices with knowledge of cloud services. I have experience deploying different projects with CI/CD pipelines on AWS. I can provide consultancy services for your project architecture, infrastructure and help with task management within the team.

item.title: Read more!
item.description: Nice to see you here and thank you for showing interest to know me. One word to describe me would be “philomath”. Yes, a philomath. A single word that describes me and my thirst for knowledge. Philomath originates from combining 2 greek words, “Philos and “math” that means, “lover of learning” or “knowledge seeker”. I love to learn new tools, techniques, concepts and everything that is fascinating. I learn from everyone and everything and don’t mind a constructive criticism.

item.title: What Now?
item.description: #OpenToWork I am working as a backend software engineer at Essentia Softserv LLP since July, 2021. I am working on django based web application to perform batch processing. Other than this, I am mostly reading the books listed below. I visited United States in month of May to attend Pycon US 2022. It was a nice experience. I may or may not write blog post about my experience. I enrolled in a computer architecture MOOC on coursera by Princeton University.
